divs: sighting detailsprelude info: i am 47 years old and, as a soldier, spent many months in the deserts of white sands, n.m., death valley (ft. irwin, ca.) and turkey as well back in the 80's. i've spent many hours looking up into the stars and with little to absolutely no light pollution to obscure the dimmest of stars. i've been star gazing all my life and always liked searching for satellites crossing my view. something i've noticed, which brings me to my report, is the fact that there are now "things" going on that i never noticed back then. not that they did not happen, it's just that it seems to be something new and increasing. what i mean and, simultaneously, my newest experience ( as all of my experiences). the "satellite like" objects that traverse our space. not our regular, man made satellites but ones that stop, change course and light up seconds at a time and then disappear. i just saw again, on the morning of 10\06\2010 an object, which looked at first like a man made satellite but it crossed the sky in less than one minute! our real satellites take 7-8 minutes and never change course. this is something i never saw years ago but now, is virtually a daily thing. these objects stop, disappear and send "morse code" like signals in the form of flashes. whereby, others flash back. i just wanted to state that i am aware we are being watched and visited. i am not afraid and i accept it. i find it exciting. i have never experienced any personal encounters. no black triangles hovering, no disc with lights. just these high altitude craft. perhaps because we live on the gulf coast and there is little of interest here for them. i don't have a very good view except due east over galveston bay. maybe there is more activity closer to houston. i would really love to see one closer.
trends: There have been no other sightings in Shoreacres
This sighting has never been favorited.
